title: Elsa Pataky gushes over her daughter India after she recycles a bicycle wheel to make a model robot
text:
She's the model mother who shares three children with Chris Hemsworth.

And on Sunday, Elsa Pataky gushed over her daughter India Rose, seven, after she recycled an abandoned bicycle wheel to create a model robot.

Taking to Instagram, the 43-year-old mother shared a picture of herself and India examining the creation made from water bottles, cardboard and the wheel.

'It's amazing how children use their imagination!' Elsa Pataky (right) gushed over her daughter India (left) in an Instagram post Sunday after she recycled a bicycle wheel to make a robot

'India asked me to take this abandoned wheel from the street to build something with it,' Elsa captioned the post.

'It’s amazing how children use their imagination to create something completely new out of recyclable items. A robot on this occasion!'

The Spanish model had also translated the caption into her native tongue so followers from her homeland could understand.

Taking initiative: 'India asked me to take this abandoned wheel from the street to build something with it,' Elsa captioned the post

It is no surprise that Elsa and Chris' eldest child is a fan of recycling, as her parents are a very environmentally conscious couple.

The pair recently installed hundreds of solar panels on the roof of their $20 million Byron Bay mansion.

Chris and Elsa have three children, seven-year-old India and identical twins Tristan and Sasha, five.

The Hemsworth family: Chris and Elsa have three children, seven-year-old India and identical twins Tristan and Sasha, five. They are pictured at the Climate Strike in Byron Bay

In September, the whole family attended the Climate Strike march in Byron Bay.

Chris shared a clip of himself carrying young India in crowd shouting: 'What do we want? Climate action. When do we want it? Now.'

Elsa also took to Instagram, sharing a picture of the family walking with the Byron Bay locals in the protest.

'There is not Planet B. When the major parties don’t listen, our children speak up,' she captioned the post.
